category: Herbs that Warm the Interior and Expel Cold

action.primary: Disperses Cold, scours out Wind, overcomes Dampness and stops pain
Reduces swellings and treats abscesses and lesions

indications: Stubborn sores that do not ulcerate
Ulcerated sores that do not heal

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency conditions.
Do not use the fresh or unprocessed herb.
Use with other herbs such as Rx. Glycyrrhizae #{GanCao} Gan Cao or Rz. Zingiberis Recens #{ShengJiang} Sheng Jiang, to minimize toxicity.
incompatibilities: Incompatible with Bul. Fritillariae #{ChuanBeiMu} Chuan Bei Mu and #{ZheBeiMu} Zhe Bei Mu.
Incompatible with Fr. Trichosanthis #{GuaLou} Gua Lou.
Incompatible with Rz. Pinelliae Preparatum #{ZhiBanXia.htm} Zhi Ban Xia.
Incompatible with Rz. Bletillae #{BaiJi} Bai Ji.
Incompatible with Rx. Ampelopsis #{BaiLian} Bai Lian.
interactions: Those who have a history of cardiovascular disorders or are taking antiarrhythmic medicines such as quinidine, procainamide (Pronestyl), disopyramide ( (Norpace), flecainide (Tambocor), propefanone (Rythmol) and amiodarone (Cordarone) should take this herb with extreme caution.

useCases: As an alcohol based liniment, applied warm for Cold- Damp painful obstruction.
Topically as a paste for chilblains.
Muscle spasms and pain with difficulty in movement because of Cold-Damp or Blood Stagnation.
Shortness of breath and Coldness and pain in the chest and abdomen due to Excess Cold.
Severe pain in the chest radiating to the back.
Topically in plasters or ointments for Bi syndrome.
Mix with vinegar and apply topically for abscesses and ulcerations.

notes: Overdose will cause numbness of the lips, tongue, and extremities, vomiting, facial pallor, irritability, decrease in the pulse rate and blood pressure, difficulty in breathing, and coma.
Some sources classifies this as an "Expel Wind and Dampness" herb.
This herb is stronger and more toxic than Rx. Aconiti Preparata #{ZhiChuanWu} Zhi #{ZhiChuanWu} Chuan Wu.
The tincture is used for local anesthesia.
